snippet: China is moving sand onto reefs and shoals to add new islands to the contested Spratly archipelago, alarming Vietnam, the Philippines and other Southeast Asian nations that claim sovereignty over it.
abstract: China has been moving sand onto reefs and shoals to add several new islands to Spratly archipelago, part of effort to expand Chinese footprint in South China Sea; island-building has alarmed Vietnam, the Philippines and other Southeast Asian nations that also claim sovereignty over archipelago.

byline.original: By EDWARD WONG and JONATHAN ANSFIELD
byline.contributor: Bree Feng and Chen Jiehao contributed research.

lead_paragraph: China is moving sand onto reefs and shoals to add new islands to the contested Spratly archipelago, alarming Vietnam, the Philippines and other Southeast Asian nations that claim sovereignty over it.

headline.main: To Bolster Its Claims, China Plants Islands in Disputed Waters
headline.print_headline: China, Trying to Bolster Its Claims, Plants Islands in Disputed Waters
